name: INTRODUCTORY CHEM I

values.comments:
This course explores the basic concepts and principles of chemistry, with a greater
emphasis on problem solving.
Students found the course to be very well organized. They especially enjoyed the
workshops, Professor Pietrovito offered. Most students found the course to be very
difficult. The amount of material that was covered was said to be “astronomical.”
Many students said that Professor Pietrovito was the “best” professor they ever
had. They said he was tough, but fair. One student said, “He is so committed to seeing us
learn and making sure we understand the material as well as study tactics. I've learned
not just about Chemistry this semester, but also about how to learn.” Professor Pietrovito
is described as a passionate and dedicated professor. He has a unique ability to spark
interest in chemistry beyond what is required for the course.
This course is designed for students with a lesser background in chemistry and/or
mathematics. It is suitable for chemistry majors, non-majors, or pre-professional students.
Students said the course had a lot of work. In addition, they found it to be extremely
challenging. The tests are designed to be very difficult and normally the class average
ranges anywhere from 50 to 60 according to one student.
